newsitem.title: DUBAI: UAE oil storage project tender to be reissued.
newsitem.headline: UAE oil storage project tender to be reissued.

text.p: Tender documents for a proposed $75 million oil product storage facility in Fujairah, United Arab Emirates, will be reissued in late January after initial bids came in above original cost estimates, Gulf oil industry sources said on Monday.
Firms interested in the 3.05 million barrel capacity Fujairah facility have until the end of February to submit bids and a final contract is expected to be awarded in March.
"We're going for a re-bid...the bids came in above budget," an industry source, who declined to be named, said.

The first-phase contract to build the plant's 18 main storage tanks with a capacity of 465,000 cubic metres, a 1.5 km long jetty and infrastructural support facilities was originally scheduled to be awarded in December 1996 for a 1998 start-up.
Backers of the Fujairah facility are the Abu-Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC), Koninklijke van Ommeren NV, Swiss trading group Vitol, Kuwait-based traders IPG and the Fujairah government.
The storage and product blending facilities would allow oil trading firms to capitalise on supply opportunities in Middle East, Indian subcontinent and Asian product markets.
